intro: Durandea serrata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with leaves that are ovate and often marked with silver or white veins. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Durandea serrata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
